results.title: Giving a shop demonstration
results.brief_description: An example of good teaching practise in the school workshop and materials are assembled in preparation for the class; a demonstration by the instructor precedes practical work by students; the instruction demonstrates and explains proper methods to be used; questions are asked by the teacher and the students during the course of the work.

results.title: Given a chance
results.creator_credit: Barwon Youth Employment Office for the Employment Access Program, Community Services Victoria and Clayton Jacobson
results.brief_description: A program targeting employers, CES, welfare and youth workers assisting disadvantaged youth in the labour market. A positive image of such job seekers is promoted through interviews with young people and employers regarding their success. Provides background information about Victorian Juvenile Justice and Protective Services in relation to employing young people. Explains the role of the Employment Access Program.

results.title: Given a chance
results.brief_description: This is a video which focusses on the life experiences of refugee young people in australia. The video is divided into two sections: Section one explores the refugee experience from the perspective of 5 young who have resettled in Australia from the countries of El Salvador, Vietnam, Afghanistan, Cambodia and Eritrea. It is relevant to both workers and young people. Section two explores issues for service providers and contains interviews with experienced workers with refugee young people. The video can be used in education and training of both young people and professionals working with refugee young people. Includes video training notes.

results.title: Give yourself the green light
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the inadequacy of roads in the United States and illustrates measures to improve roads and relieve traffic congestion; municipal parking lots; express ways through crowded cities; cross-country super-highways; cloverleaf’s in various section of the country; cities and States matching federal grants for road construction and maintenance.

results.title: Give us this day
results.creator_credit: Simon Hartog, Spectre Productions, Arts Council of Great Britain and Phil Mulloy
results.brief_description: In 1910 Robert Noonan, whose pen-name was Robert Tressell, finished his book “The Ragged Trousered Philanthropist” and wrote in the title page that it was “the story of 12 months in hell told by one of the damned”. This fully dramatised film is based on the fragments of information known about his life, his writing and the political events of the 9 years he spent in England.

results.title: Give us a smile
results.brief_description: A lively presentation, in animated form, protesting against a range of sexist attitudes maintained by our society. For example, shows the role played by advertising and pornography in these processes and records the efforts of women who fight back against such violence.

results.title: Give us a go
results.creator_credit: Materials Production, Education Dept for Equal Opportunity Board and Diane Charleson
results.brief_description: An explanation of the functions of the Equal Opportunity Board as it relates to the disabled. Various examples of discrimination are shown together with re-enactments showing conciliation and Board hearings.

results.title: Give trees a chance: the story of Terania Creek
results.creator_credit: Sydney Filmmakers Co-operative and Jeni Kendell
results.brief_description: Terania Creek is the site of a threatened rainforest. Presents the stand taken by conservationists against the Forestry Commission and police to try to save the last of the virgin rainforest at Terania Creek and to argue for an environmental impact study. Narrated by Jack Thompson.

results.title: Give them a chance: we very much regret
results.creator_credit: Stanley Wright, Rank Screen Services, Office of the United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees and Michael Palmer
results.brief_description: This film was made in a refugee camp in Europe to show conditions in which the refugees have been living for many years. It depicts, as an almost everyday incident, the bitter disappointment felt by a refugee family when their application to go overseas is turned down. Includes a statement by the High Commissioner for Refugees on the efforts made by his office to clear the camps in Europe by the end of 1960.

results.title: Give them a chance: mission to no-man's land
results.creator_credit: Stanley Wright, Rank Film Productions, BBC and Georges Pessis
results.brief_description: Filmed during the World refugee year appeal, Yul Brynner reports on the refugee problem facing the world ten years after World War II. People still live in these refugee camps all over the world, being denied citizenship over and over again. Some are interviewed and convey the overwhelming frustration of years of trying to seek some sort of stabilty.
